content.content: Update Hello Kindly take note of the following post:     Simple MakerDAO — Governance from first principles Governance   Executive summary This proposal describes a series of simple governance changes to MakerDAO that would address many problems that exist in governance today. These include a general lack of vision and strategy as well as low accountability to MKR holders.   Table of contents  Executive summary Why we need to talk about this now Problem statements Maker has an identity crisis Maker has a governance crisis Proposal Main idea #1: Create a Constitution for Maker Main idea #2: Establish a Counc…    Agenda  Selection of lounge music Introduction Brief (5-10’) overview of Hasu’s proposal  Remainder of the time (1h50) open to moderated Q&A and debate  We’d like to have as much time as possible putting the spotlight on members of the community and on Q&A.  Contributors: @adcv @Aes @hexonaut @teej @luca_pro @Nadia @MarianoDP @SebVentures @Eumenes @Hasu Hello, Next week, an informal group of colleagues would like to share some views around governance and propose specific alternatives for reform to strengthen MakerDAO and enable it to build a world-leading lending platform and a world-changing decentralized stablecoin. Some of these views already exist in various forms throughout the DAO. We are trying to kick-start a process to give them shape and turn them into actionable items for governance to enact. Community and especially MKR token holder feedback will be crucial to shaping a coherent view. We have a great possibilities ahead of us but a robust structure must be in place to capitalize fully on the opportunity. Our aim is to maximize attention towards token holders, create systems of accountable supervision of Core Units and empower an effective cadre of delegates who are responsible for a coherent direction. First principles, common sense governance.  Call Details On this call, we would like to talk about the principles that are driving the initiative, gather early feedback as we continue formulating a coherent set of governance proposals and share next steps. So… another party is forming then?

Thank you @adcv. In the interest of full transparency and, most importantly, good manners, we have informed the large MKR holders we know of (and that not necessarily spend all their time on forum) via email so that they can participate.

Just a proposal for governance reform starting from the status quo. This plan is independent of the endgame plan or variants thereof. I’d wager most of the contributors are deeply uninterested in politics and would rather prefer to orient Maker towards serving the token holder, achieving business objectives and building an unassailable decentralized stablecoin.
Slogans like “First principles, common sense governance” sound pretty politicky to me. I guess that’s why I was confused.  Looking forward to the call!

adcv:  Call Details On this call, we would like to talk about the principles that are driving the initiative, gather early feedback as we continue formulating a coherent set of governance proposals and share next steps.  Zoom Link: Launch Meeting - Zoom    Add to Calendar   2022-06-30T17:00:00Z   Hello Kind reminder the calendar details are above and should be in the Governance calendar. Will update the OP with notes, slides and hopefully some more memes about inflation.

The DAO is probably on the verge of turning over various points, regarding structuring and development, there will probably be major changes maybe not at all, I have participated in some voter committees because I find the ideas exciting, however, I like MakerDAO, I’m afraid that someone wants to swear something too radical. Maybe it will form into something good but I don’t know if it will cause too much conflict because it will limit the CU, I also want to participate here hoping to become less political and more focused on the DAO and hoping to gain a different perspective from the Endgame.

luca_pro:  In the interest of full transparency and, most importantly, good manners, we have informed the large MKR holders we know of (and that not necessarily spend all their time on forum) via email so that they can participate.   might be me, but: good manners would be to loop in the community first before reaching out to VCs. really no surprise people getting paranoid about closed door meetings and stuff. that’s not how consensus building should be done
i and others heard rumors about this meeting long before the official announcement.

I have sustained this for too long. Email and post were sent pretty much contextually. I will go and check time stamps on what left first when I will have the time for your benefit. To clarify, email was sent to every large MKR holder we know of, simply because not everyone lives on forum. This list included also your employer, @ultraschuppi. I nevertheless appreciate your suggestions on the ability of consensus building, it is a powerful art that we should all learn to perfect. I can try to pay back by teaching the good manners instead.

I believe one was sent in the European AM and the other in the US AM. Or at least within the same day, by two different people. Thank you again for your comment anyway, it is important that independent delegates look after the issues of this protocol.

luca_pro:  To clarify, email was sent to every large MKR holder we know of, simply because not everyone lives on forum. This list included also your employer, @ultraschuppi.   I don’t have an employer. My largest delegator recently pulled off 50% of the voting power and I am still here. The community is not only large MKR holders.

I will repeat this again. This public call was organised for the community and posted for the community on forum. At the same time put in the governance calendar. And at the same time large MKR holders that might be relevant but that we know might not live on forum were informed. Unfortunately I do not have the emails of all community members. I have operated professionally and in good manners for this protocol over many months, and have been put under unpleasant pressure in several occasions, also during the ongoing voting window. I would kindly ask you to stop doing it, or at least to concede me a break so that I can dedicate more mental energy to my mental wellbeing. Thank you
